title: Compact W-Section Beam Flexural Design (LRFD)
problem: Select the lightest W-shape beam to span 28 feet and support a uniform service dead load of 0.85 kip/ft and a uniform service live load of 1.50 kip/ft. The beam has continuous lateral support and is A992 Grade 50 steel. Use LRFD design method.
required: Select the lightest W-shape beam for flexural strength.

solution_steps.title: Calculate Factored Loads
solution_steps.content:
Using LRFD load combination:

$$w_u = 1.2D + 1.6L = 1.2(0.85) + 1.6(1.50) = 1.02 + 2.40 = 3.42 \text{ kip/ft}$$

solution_steps.title: Calculate Factored Moment
solution_steps.content:
Maximum moment for simply supported beam:

$$M_u = \frac{w_u L^2}{8} = \frac{3.42 \times (28)^2}{8} = 335.2 \text{ kip-ft}$$

solution_steps.title: Determine Required Plastic Section Modulus
solution_steps.content:
For compact section with continuous lateral support:

$$Z_x \geq \frac{M_u}{\phi_b \times F_y} = \frac{335.2 \times 12}{0.90 \times 50} = 89.4 \text{ in}^3$$

solution_steps.title: Select Lightest W-Section
solution_steps.content:
From AISC Manual Table 3-2:

- W21×44: $Z_x = 95.4$ in³, weight = 44 lb/ft
- W18×46: $Z_x = 90.7$ in³, weight = 46 lb/ft

**W21×44 is the lightest section meeting the requirement.**

solution_steps.title: Calculate Design Strength
solution_steps.content: $$\phi_b M_n = 0.90 \times 50 \times \frac{95.4}{12} = 357.8 \text{ kip-ft} > M_u = 335.2 \text{ kip-ft}$$ ✓

final_answer: Select **W21×44** (weight = 44 lb/ft) with $\phi_b M_n = 358$ kip-ft $> M_u = 335.2$ kip-ft. The beam has continuous lateral support and is compact.

title: Beam-Column Interaction Check (LRFD)
problem: A W10×49 column is subjected to factored LRFD loads: $P_u = 280$ kips (axial compression) and $M_{ux} = 85$ kip-ft (strong axis bending). The column has effective lengths $K_x L_x = 14$ ft and $K_y L_y = 12$ ft. The column is part of a braced frame and has A992 Grade 50 steel. Check if the section is adequate.
required: Check the adequacy of W10×49 using AISC interaction equations.

solution_steps.title: Determine Section Properties
solution_steps.content:
From AISC Manual Table 1-1 for W10×49:

- $A = 14.4$ in²
- $r_x = 4.35$ in, $r_y = 2.54$ in
- $Z_x = 60.4$ in³

From Table 4-1: $\phi_c P_n = 423$ kips for $K_y L_y = 12$ ft

solution_steps.title: Calculate Slenderness Ratios
solution_steps.content:
$$\lambda_x = \frac{K_x L_x}{r_x} = \frac{14 \times 12}{4.35} = 38.6$$

$$\lambda_y = \frac{K_y L_y}{r_y} = \frac{12 \times 12}{2.54} = 56.7$$

$\lambda_y > \lambda_x$, so **y-axis governs** for buckling.

solution_steps.title: Calculate Axial Load Ratio
solution_steps.content:
$$P_r = \frac{P_u}{\phi_c P_n} = \frac{280}{423} = 0.662$$

Since $P_r > 0.2$, use **Equation H1-1a**:
$$P_r + \frac{8}{9}(M_{rx}) \leq 1.0$$

solution_steps.title: Determine Flexural Capacity
solution_steps.content:
From AISC Manual Table 3-10 for W10×49 with $L_b = 14$ ft:

$\phi_b M_n \approx 195$ kip-ft (inelastic LTB governs)

$$M_{rx} = \frac{M_{ux}}{\phi_b M_n} = \frac{85}{195} = 0.436$$

final_answer: The W10×49 is **NOT adequate**. The interaction ratio is $1.05 > 1.0$. A larger section such as W10×54 or W10×60 should be selected.

title: Concrete Beam Shear Design
problem: A 20-inch wide by 28-inch deep reinforced concrete beam spans 18 feet and supports a factored uniform load $w_u = 8.5$ kips/ft. Use $f'_c = 4,000$ psi and Grade 60 stirrups. Determine the required stirrup spacing at the critical section located at distance d from the support.
required: Determine the required stirrup spacing at the critical section.

solution_steps.title: Calculate Shear at Critical Section
solution_steps.content:
Support reaction: $V_u(support) = \frac{w_u L}{2} = \frac{8.5 \times 18}{2} = 76.5$ kips

Critical section at distance d from support:
$$V_u = 76.5 - 8.5 \times \frac{25.5}{12} = 76.5 - 18.1 = 58.4 \text{ kips}$$

solution_steps.title: Calculate Concrete Shear Capacity
solution_steps.content:
Per ACI 318-19 Section 22.5.5.1:

$$V_c = 2\sqrt{f'_c} \times b \times d = 2\sqrt{4000} \times 20 \times 25.5 / 1000 = 64.5 \text{ kips}$$

solution_steps.title: Check If Stirrups Are Required
solution_steps.content:
$$\phi V_c = 0.75 \times 64.5 = 48.4 \text{ kips}$$

Since $V_u = 58.4$ kips $> \phi V_c = 48.4$ kips, stirrups are required.

solution_steps.title: Calculate Required Stirrup Spacing
solution_steps.content:
Per ACI 318-19 Section 22.5.10.5.3:

$$s = \frac{A_v f_y d}{V_s} = \frac{0.40 \times 60,000 \times 25.5}{13,400} = 45.7 \text{ in}$$

Maximum spacing: $s_{max} = \min(d/2, 24 \text{ in}) = 12.75$ in

**Use s = 12 in**

final_answer: Use **#4 stirrups at 12 inches on center** near the supports. This provides $\phi(V_c + V_s) = 86.6$ kips $> V_u = 58.4$ kips.

title: Column Buckling Analysis
problem: A W12×65 column (A992 steel) has an effective length $KL = 18$ ft about both axes. Determine the available compressive strength and check if the column can support a service dead load of 200 kips and service live load of 300 kips.
required: Determine available compressive strength and check adequacy.

solution_steps.title: Determine Section Properties
solution_steps.content:
From AISC Manual Table 1-1 for W12×65:

- $A = 19.1$ in²
- $r_y = 3.02$ in (governs)

solution_steps.title: Calculate Slenderness Ratio
solution_steps.content: $$\lambda = \frac{KL}{r_y} = \frac{18 \times 12}{3.02} = 71.5$$

solution_steps.title: Determine Critical Stress
solution_steps.content:
From AISC Manual Table 4-1 for W12×65 with $KL = 18$ ft:

$$\phi_c P_n = 559 \text{ kips}$$ (LRFD)

$$P_n/\Omega_c = 372 \text{ kips}$$ (ASD)

solution_steps.title: Check Adequacy
solution_steps.content:
**LRFD:** $\phi_c P_n = 559$ kips $< P_u = 720$ kips ✗ **FAILS**

**ASD:** $P_n/\Omega_c = 372$ kips $< P_a = 500$ kips ✗ **FAILS**

The column is **NOT adequate** for the applied loads.

final_answer: The W12×65 column is **NOT adequate**. LRFD capacity = 559 kips $<$ required 720 kips. A larger section or shorter unbraced length is needed.
